intro: Brunfelsia magnifica, commonly known as the angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other nightshade plants. It produces showy, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and moths. The leaves are dark green and oval-shaped, providing a lush backdrop to its dramatic flowers.
